Articles.Content:
For the past 2 months, since upgrading my computer, I cannot get sound out of the game. The game (from versions 1.2.2 to 1.3.1), launches fine, plays fine, but I have no sound. This changed when I upgraded my computer in early December. I did the full upgrade, including motherboard, processor, graphics card and memory. Since then I have no sound. All of my other games, like War Thunder, Warcraft, Cities Skylines all produce sound. It's a damn mystery to me. I've checked drivers, volume levels, reverted to earlier builds, inputs...  it's all the same. I've tried the 32bit and 64 bit version, still the same. I'm pulling my hair out. Before anyone asks, this is a stock install. Below is the hardware I have:

Asus ROG Maximus X
Intel 8700K
Nvidia 1070i Card (Asus)
32GB DDR4 
Realtek Sound Card (Motherboard) with 6.0.1.8273 Drivers
Windows 10 x64
 

Help?

I know is an old thread, but I had this problem and was getting crazy about it. Finally, I found out:

If you have an ASUS motherboard also and happens to have ASUS Sonic Studio 3 installed, kill it with fire.

Close it in the system tray. 
Worked like a charm.
